content:
Despite last-minute changes to the deal, MPs may well throw it out again. The margin of defeat will affect what happens next

Editor’s note: This piece has been updated to include Geoffrey Cox’s legal opinion

AFTER WINNING a few last-minute changes to her Brexit deal in a dramatic dash to Strasbourg last night, Theresa May faces another series of difficult votes in Parliament. The votes will begin this evening with a second go at getting MPs to approve the draft exit deal that they rejected by the huge majority of 230 votes in January.

Since then government ministers, including Geoffrey Cox, the attorney-general, have been trying to amend the deal to make it more palatable to Parliament. Their aim was to create a legally binding unilateral exit mechanism for Britain from the “Irish backstop”, an insurance policy designed to avoid a hard border in Ireland by keeping the United Kingdom in a customs union with the EU. Until last night the European Union was refusing to give ground, arguing that to do so would undermine the purpose of the backstop.

The new deal agreed by Mrs May and Jean-Claude Juncker, the European Commission president, offers more legal undertakings that the EU regards the backstop as undesirable and temporary, and will do its utmost to agree an alternative way of avoiding a hard border in Ireland. It spells out in more detail the conditions under which the UK could seek to exit the backstop if it were triggered, including the terms of an arbitration mechanism if the two sides disagree. And it is accompanied by a unilateral declaration by the British government about how it might set the process of exit in motion.

The changes fall short of what many Brexit hardliners wanted. In a legal opinion published this morning, Mr Cox concluded that, although the new measures “reduce the risk that the United Kingdom could be indefinitely and involuntarily” trapped in the backstop, “the legal risk remains unchanged” that if the two sides cannot agree on an alternative then “the United Kingdom would have, at least while the fundamental circumstances remained the same, no internationally lawful means of exiting [the backstop], save by agreement.”

The amendments may nonetheless be enough to win over some of those who opposed the deal in January and have since had second thoughts. Much will turn on the position of the Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party, which voted against the deal last time. If it backs the plan, many Tory MPs are likely to follow suit. Yet the huge scale of the defeat last time means that, even if quite a few mps change sides, it is unlikely that the deal will go through.

Much will depend on the margin of defeat tonight. If it is well below 100, there will be hope that a few more weeks of debate, and further pressure on Brexit-backing MPs who are fretful that delay could frustrate their goal altogether, may allow Mrs May to get the deal through on a third or fourth attempt. But if the defeat is another heavy one, there will be doubts about her ability to get anything at all through Parliament. That could point to a rethink of the entire shape of the deal, perhaps towards a softer Brexit, for instance keeping Britain in a permanent customs union with the EU. Any such arrangement might be supplemented by a plan to maintain close alignment with the EU’s single market.

Another possible outcome of a second big defeat in Parliament and a firm rejection of no deal would be to encourage demands for a second referendum. A minority of MPs from all parties have long called for such a “People’s Vote”, and the Labour opposition leader, Jeremy Corbyn, recently gave his conditional support to the idea. Although there does not seem to be Parliamentary majority for it, there may be one for a variant: to endorse Mrs May’s deal if it is put to a referendum for final approval, with staying in the EU as the other option.

Critics of Mrs May on both sides of the Brexit debate are grumbling about the uncertainties. A growing number of Tories are suggesting she should quit as prime minister. Meanwhile polls suggest that many voters just want the whole business to be over.

"We must persevere in this war as people, as a government, as a parliamentary group in order for the country to win it," Papandreou said.
帕潘德里欧说：“在这场战争中，我们必须要作为一个人、一个政府及国会团体坚贞不屈，让我们的国家能赢得战争。

ex: adj. 永久性；一直；坚持；不变的
n. 恒齿；永久齿；电烫发；积和式
网络 永久的；持久的；固定的
eg2: a permanent job
固定工作
permanent staff
固定职工
They are now living together on a permanent basis.
他们现在是长期同住。
The accident has not done any permanent damage.
那场事故没有造成什么永久性损伤。
a permanent fixture(= a person or an object that is always in a particular place)
固定于某处的人／东西

wp.Referendum Act: 公民投票法;简称公投法
wp.Maastricht referendum: 欧共体一些成员国对马斯特里赫特条约进行的公民复决投票

ex: n. 公民投票权；外交官请示书
n. 补遗；增补（物）；补充（物）；添加物
网络 增刊；附录；副刊
eg2: vitamin/dietary supplements(= vitamins and other foods eaten in addition to what you usually eat)
补充的维生素；补充饮食
Industrial sponsorship is a supplement to government funding.
工业界的赞助是对政府拨款的补充。
the Sunday colour supplements
星期日彩色增刊
the supplement to the Oxford English Dictionary
《牛津英语词典》补编
There is a £10 supplement for a single room.
住单间另付 10 英镑。
Safety deposit boxes are available at a supplement .
有贵重物品保管箱可供使用，费用另计。
a diet supplemented with vitamin pills
搭配有维生素片的饮食
He supplements his income by giving private lessons.
他当家庭教师以补充收入。

wp.temporary payments: 暂付款;暂付款项;暂付金钱
wp.temporary line: 临时线路;临时公交线路;便线
wp.temporary receipt: 临时收据;暂收款;姑且收据;暂收款项
wp.temporary worker: 临时工;临时工人;暂时工;姑且工
wp.temporary object: 临时对象;暂时物件;暂存物件;暂存对象
wp.temporary files: 临时文件;暂存档;暂存档案;临时文件暂存档
wp.temporary debit: 暂付款项;临时借款;财经;暂借款
wp.temporary support: 临时支撑;临时支架;临时支护;临时支承

eg2: He found a temporary lodgment in Paris.
他在巴黎找到了一个临时住所。
He afforded a  shelter for the needy.
他为穷人提供暂时的安身之处。
There were fewer temporary engineers to plug in in that city because of low pay.
由于报酬低，该城市雇用得到的临时工程师就更少了。

ex: adj. 捕获的；陷入困境的；收集的；受到限制的
n. 触发器；（枪的）扳机；（尤指引发不良反应或发展的）起因；引爆器
v. 触发；引起；发动；开动
网络 板机；触发程序；启动
eg2: to pull/squeeze the trigger
扣扳机
He kept his finger on the trigger.
他的手指一直勾着扳机。
The trigger for the strike was the closure of yet another factory.
触发这次罢工的是又一家工厂被关闭了。
nuclear triggers
核引爆器
Nuts can trigger off a violent allergic reaction.
坚果可以引起严重的过敏反应。
to trigger an alarm
触发警报器

ex: vt. 扭；捏；拧；微调（工程机械等术语）；使焦虑；使焦躁

wp.Tweak mode: 调整模式;功能;扭曲模式
wp.Tweak UI: 界面设计模块;下载;系统修正器;软件可以提供隐藏功能
wp.WINner Tweak: 系统优化专家;系统设置调整软件

eg2: That way you have a lot of time to tweak and improve.
那样你就有很多的时间来调整和完善你的机器人。
Get your idea out there, get feedback, , get more feedback, and keep it up!
把你的想法实行出来、得到反馈、再接再励、获得更多反馈、继续保持！
I like to think of querystrings as the knobs of URLs — something to  your current view and fine tune it to your liking. That’s why they work so great for sorting and filtering actions.
我喜欢把查询串想象成URL的旋钮——其调整你的当前视图，把它按照你的喜好来进行微调，这就是为什么它们用在排序和过滤这些行为上会如此之棒。

wp.remain unchanged: 保持不变;维持不变;保持没变;保持原状

eg2: All the examples in book use the core syntax, which we expect to remain unchanged going forward.
在书中所有例子所使用的这些核心语法，我们希望将来都会保持不变。
By passing the interesting information to the endpoint inside a document, you can leave the endpoint definition  across both major and minor upgrades to either side of the conversation.
通过将有趣的端点信息传送到一个文档内，您可以在通信双方任意一方主要升级和次要升级过程中保持端点定义不变。
Once tests have been targeted to cover only changed function, any results from unchanged areas of code may then be carried forward from one build to the next.
一旦确定了测试的目标是只覆盖变更的功能，那么来自于未变更代码区域的结果就可能从一次构建转移到下一次。

wp.undermine e: 暗中破坏;危害;破坏;侵蚀…的基础

ex: vt. 破坏，渐渐破坏；挖掘地基
eg2: His enemies are spreading rumours to undermine his authority.
他的敌人在散布谣言来暗中破坏他的威信。
That’s why I won’t accept any attempts to undermine the independence of this agency.
这就是为什么我不会容忍任何破坏这一机构的独立性的企图。
Neither side supports any attempts by any force to  this principle.
双方均不支持任何势力企图破坏这一原则的行动。

ex: vt. 承担，保证；从事；同意；试图

wp.undertake sth: 承担某事;决定做某事;着手

eg2: We could undertake the work for the time being.
我们可以暂时从事这项工作。
Who will undertake responsibility for this work?
谁将承担这项工作的责任?
Do not undertake a project unless you can implement it.
不要承担一项计划，除非你能完成这项计划。

ex: adj. 不良的；不受欢迎的；不合需要的
n. 不良分子；不受欢迎的人

wp.Undesirable Effect: 不良效应;量造成不想要效果;定义问题;不良结果
wp.So undesirable: 没一点必要;没有一点必要
wp.undesirable person: 不良分子;不良份子;翻译

eg2: This will have an undesirable effect on query optimization.
这对于查询的优化有着不良的影响。
Now I use the word steer, because if you simply demand a cessation of contact by your children with a set of undesirable peers, you will get nothing but resistance.
现在我使用言语来引导孩子，因为如果你只是简单的要求孩子停止与周围不良同伴的联系的话，你能得到的只会是抵抗。
Was I so ?
我会如此不良的吗?

ex: adj. 单边的；[植] 单侧的；单方面的；单边音；（父母）单系的

wp.Unilateral Transfer: 单方面转移收支;		单方面转让;单边转让;单边转移
wp.unilateral transducer: 单向传感器;		单向换能器;		单向转换器;单测换能器
wp.Unilateral transfers: 单方面转移;片面移转;单方面转移支付;经常转移

eg2: Because that they think the means we should employ are unilateral and militaty.
他们认为,我们采用的方法应该是,单方面和武力的。
No Party or anyone acting on its behalf may have any  communication with the Panel.
诉讼方或它的任何代表都不可以与陪审团有单方面的通信联系。
The Chinese Government never regards aid to other countries as a kind of unilateral alms but as sth. mutual.
中国政府从来不把对外援助看作是单方面的恩赐， 而认为援助是相互的。
He showed the greatest [the ] patience.
他表现出最大的耐心。
Now that you put your hand to the work, you should do your  to finish it.
既然你已经着手这项工作了， 那就应该尽力完成它。
Let men tremble to win the hand of woman, unless they win along with it the  passion of her heart!
让那些只赢得女人首肯婚约但没有同时赢得她们内心最深处的激情的男人们发抖吧！

wp.Time Variant: 反映历史变化;时变;变化的;反应历史变化
wp.Variant angina: 变异型心绞痛;变异性心绞痛;狭心症;变异型

eg2: Note that you must use the same variant of this option for all compiler runs related to the same project.
注意，对于所有运行的与同一个项目相关的编译器，必须使用这个选项的相同变体。
Product : This is a product that is based on another product but with some different characteristics.
产品变体：这是一种基于另一种产品但具备一些不同特性的产品。
So selection for one variant can have all sorts of seemingly unrelated effects.
所以选择一种变体可能产生表面上毫不相关的影响。

Title: Theresa May’s tweaked Brexit deal returns to Parliament

paperStatistics.title: Theresa May’s tweaked Brexit deal returns to Parliament
paperStatistics.desc: Despite last-minute changes to the deal, MPs may well throw it out again. The margin of defeat will affect what happens next
